System Name: Fuel System

System Description: The Fuel System is a system that describes the fuel supply and return process between the fuel tank assembly and the engine of a motor vehicle. The system is designed to support interface connections between different components, ensuring smooth and well-integrated fuel supply routes, and meeting the requirements for stability and reliability of fuel supply during vehicle operation. The system can monitor key parameters such as temperature to ensure the safety and efficiency of fuel supply.

The vehicle is a core component of the system and is capable of autonomously managing its operation and health status under different conditions.

The vehicle controller is responsible for receiving and processing various control and status signals from the vehicle to enable automatic control operations such as starting and shutting down.

The temperature is a critical parameter that can affect the vehicle's operation and health status.

The warning signal is generated when overheating is detected, indicating a potential issue that requires immediate attention.

The vehicle is designed with health management mechanisms to ensure timely maintenance and restoration from abnormal states to normal.

The vehicle model is represented as a black box with the following properties:

* Mass (m): The mass of the vehicle in kilograms.
* Position (p): The position of the vehicle in meters.
* Velocity (v): The velocity of the vehicle in meters per second.
* Acceleration (a): The acceleration of the vehicle in meters per second squared.

The road model is represented as a black box with the following properties:

* Slope (slope angle): The angle of the road surface in radians.
* Surface friction coefficient (f): The coefficient of friction between the tires and the road surface in Newtons per meter.

The system model is represented as a black box with the following properties:

* Time (t): The current time in seconds.
* Snapshot (snapshot): A list of parameters for the vehicle and road at a specific time point in the simulation.
* Record (record): A list of snapshots from the simulation that can be used for tracking the vehicle’s state transitions.

The vehicle state is represented as a black box with the following properties:

* State (s): The current state of the vehicle.

<sysml:description>This system is designed to provide multiple configuration management solutions for automotive products. The automobile, as the main system, can select different subsystem configurations according to various needs and conditions. The system mainly includes two configurable components: Subsystem A and Subsystem B. Subsystem A offers two configuration options: one consisting of Component 1 and Component 2, and the other consisting of Component 2 and Component 3. Similarly, Subsystem B also has two configuration options: one consisting of Component 4 and Component 5, and the other consisting of Component 5 and Component 6. When configuring a vehicle, users can choose different implementations of the above subsystems as needed, but must comply with the following constraint: if the second configuration of Subsystem A is selected, then Subsystem B must select the third configuration, or Subsystem A must not be the second configuration. In addition, the system comes with two predefined vehicle configurations, namely Configuration A and Configuration B. Configuration A adopts the first implementation of Subsystem A (Component 1 and Component 2) together with the third implementation of Subsystem B (Component 4 and Component 5

<sysml:description>This system is designed to provide flexible solutions for vehicle product line configuration, capable of automatically matching suitable combinations of engines, transmissions, and wheels based on different performance requirements and user preferences. For example, when high performance is required, the system will configure a 6-cylinder engine, automatic transmission, and wide-rim wheels, ensuring compatibility among these components. For standard performance requirements, a combination of a 4-cylinder engine, manual transmission, and narrow-rim wheels is offered. The system enforces a series of configuration constraints to ensure that each configuration scheme meets vehicle performance and component compatibility requirements, preventing unreasonable combinations. Ultimately, it enables customized vehicles tailored to individual user needs. Additionally, the system supports the selection of multiple vehicle model variants, allowing enterprises to quickly respond to market demands and achieve flexible expansion and management of their product lines.</sysml:description>

* The system is a high-performance model if it is equipped with a six-cylinder engine.
* The system is not equipped with a high-performance model if it is equipped with a four-cylinder engine.
* The system has only two valid powertrain combinations: either a four-cylinder engine with a manual transmission, or a six-cylinder engine with an automatic transmission.

The system has the following relationships:

* The engine and transmission are connected to each other.
* The engine is connected to the powertrain control module.
* The powertrain control module is connected to the transmission.

* The system should use the mission liftoff time as the reference time zero, measured in seconds, and be able to take the UTC liftoff time of the mission (for example, 22:42:32.924534 on August 23, 2020) as the reference time.
* The system should collect key parameters including the position and velocity of the spacecraft at different time points.
* Each set of sampled data must associate a specific time point with the corresponding position and velocity data.
* Both the three-dimensional position and velocity should be described in a Cartesian coordinate system, with units of meters and meters per second, respectively.
* The system should record multiple sampling points during the ascent phase, with each sampling point containing explicit information on time, position, and velocity, in order to provide accurate data support for subsequent trajectory analysis and performance evaluation.

Vehicle Control Signal Transition

vehicle control signal = vehicle start signal when vehicle state is "off"

vehicle control signal = vehicle shutdown signal when vehicle state is "on"

vehicle control signal = vehicle start signal and vehicle state = "off"

vehicle control signal = vehicle power-on signal and vehicle state = "starting" or "on"

<sysml:System>
<sysml:description>This system is designed to enable intelligent monitoring and management of vehicle health status. During normal operation, the system automatically senses the current vehicle temperature and compares it with the preset maximum allowable temperature. If the vehicle temperature exceeds the maximum allowable value, the system promptly sends an over-temperature warning to the vehicle controller and switches the vehicle health status to "degraded" mode; when the temperature returns to a safe range, the status automatically reverts to normal. In addition, the vehicle undergoes periodic maintenance at scheduled intervals. When the specified maintenance time is reached, the system automatically enters maintenance status, and after maintenance is completed, the next maintenance cycle time is updated. After the maintenance status has lasted for 48 hours, the vehicle automatically returns to normal operating status. This system operates automatically, helping users to detect and address vehicle over-temperature and maintenance needs in a timely manner, thereby enhancing the safety and reliability of vehicle operation and reducing manual intervention.</sysml:description>

Explanation:

The Object element represents an object with mass attributes. The Basic Mass element represents the basic mass of the object. The Subcomponent element represents a subcomponent of the object. The Mass element represents the mass of a subcomponent. The Total Mass element represents the total mass of the object, which can be calculated based on the basic mass and the mass of all subcomponents. The Minimum Mass Threshold element represents the minimum mass threshold that can be set to filter and aggregate components based on their mass.

System Requirements:

* The system must indicate the distribution of components within the vehicle structure.
* The system must specify the safety or protection functions of the components.

System Use Cases:

* Vehicle Feature Annotation
* Vehicle Configuration Management
* Vehicle Maintenance

System Description:

The Vehicle Feature Annotation System is a system for annotating the safety and anti-theft configurations of various parts within a complete vehicle model. The system consists of two main assemblies: the Interior and the Body Assembly. The Interior Assembly includes components such as seat belts, front seats, driver airbags, and alarm system, while the Body Assembly includes the body shell, bumpers, and keyless entry device. The system is designed to indicate the distribution of these components within the vehicle structure and specify their respective safety or protection functions to comprehensively meet requirements for automotive safety and protection
